Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...From late Friday night through late Saturday night.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued March 10 at 7:08PM EST until March 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Northwest winds around 40 to 55 mph are likely, with the strongest winds Saturday afternoon and evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Grant; Western Mineral; Western Pendleton

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 10 at 7:51PM MST until March 11 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected. * WHERE...Locations mainly west of Interstate 25. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued March 10 at 7:42PM MST until March 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 11 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. * WHEN...From 11 AM Friday to 11 PM MST Saturday.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued March 10 at 7:42PM MST until March 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday evening.
